_header: Jesu of a maid Thou wouldest be born
Note: Stanzas 1 and 4 similar to lines 1-4 of 5079.
_description: A song of Jesus the Saviour — five quatrains (aabb) with ‘Miserere nobis’ refrain and four-line burden: ‘Iesu fili virginis / miserere nobis’ (repeated)

OxfLinLat141.First Lines:
Jhesu of a maydyn woldyst be borneTo sawe mankynd þat was
                    forlorneAnd all for owr mysmiserere nobis…
OxfLinLat141.Last Lines:
…That we mow se þi fasIn hewen blysse miserere
                        nobis
OxfLinLat141.Editions:
Palti,  Kathleen. 
             “An Unpublished Fifteenth-Century Carol Collection: Oxford, Lincoln
                College MS Lat. 141.” 
             Medium Aevum.
         77 (2008): 260-78: 269.

BLAdd5665.First Lines:
Jhesu of a mayde thow woldest be bornTo saue mankynde that was
                    forlorn…
BLAdd5665.Last Lines:
…And thow deidist vpon the rode treeFor owre
                        mysseMiserere nobis
BLAdd5665.Note: 2 stanzas and burden only; music by Richard Smert.
BLAdd5665.Editions:
Fehr,  Bernhard.
